file_content.text: Thank you for your help.
It's good to see you back. I knew those slaves couldn't hold their own against you.
I take it you managed to track down one of the murderers. What's their story? Can we use them?
Here. Your answer is on this datapad.
I brought a message.
The killers will now serve the Empire. I have their oath of allegiance here.
The murderers are ours.
They're crazy, but they may be useful. They sent this.
That was bizarre.
What do you mean? Let me see that datapad.
This is madness. They're serious? Slaves who think they can become Sith!
Those killers are closer to Sith than you'll ever be.
They're strong.
A slave can become Sith. Never forget that.
Slaves can be Sith.
Yes. As you say.
We use the tools we're given. No matter what they are.
They may be useful.
Doesn't seem any sicker than the rest of the Empire.
You people have done worse.
That's--watch your tongue, bounty hunter.
It wasn't my idea.
I understand. Of course. Of course you're right.
You've got a weak stomach, Ensign.
Pathetic.
Apologies. I just--no. You're right, of course.
I'll inform Command. I'm not--I'm not actually authorized to speak with the Sith Lords on the blockade, but I'll make sure they know, too.
They were crazy--they thought they were Sith.
They're madmen.
They--what? The arrogance! We'll make sure their delusional heresies don't spread.
No. But they've been dealt with--they won't cause any problems.
I handled them.
That's a pity. It's foolish, I guess, to expect anything useful to come from the minds of slaves.
No. Not without lowering ourselves to their level.
It'd be wrong to help them.
Fair enough. We needn't to mar our dignity by associating with filth.
I talked to my superiors while you were gone, and they agreed to compensate you for your work. So, uh, here. More credits than I make in a week.
I'd ask you to stick around in case the slaves cause more trouble, but I suppose you have other responsibilities.
I have havoc to wreak.
I do.
The machinations of the Sith require constant attention, Ensign.
I do.
People to hunt, bounties to collect.
I've got work.
Yes. Yes, of course.
You could say that. Imperial Intelligence keeps me busy.
That's correct.
It's been an honor working with you. I--I hope we meet again.
It would have been nice to put an end to this rebellion.
Too bad the revolt goes on.
We'll find another way to put those animals down. If the uprising gets out of control, one quick orbital strike will always solve it.
Goodbye.
Good luck to you, then. And thank you again.
Looks like you've made some interesting discoveries--but we need more to go on.
Let me know when you've tracked down those murderous slaves.
My lord--look at them out there. They're like animals.
Look at them out there. They're like animals.
Hundreds of slaves, with no one to command them and without a thought in their minds as to what to do with their "freedom."
I don't remember asking for your opinion.
Excuse me?
No! Of course not. Apologies for my presumption.
I'm Ensign Corian Shye. I didn't mean to step out of line. I presume you're here to reinforce us?
Slaves?
They were building a Sith monument until they got riled up. Then they killed the guards and seized the weapons and machinery.
But now with this blockade in place, they're not going anywhere. Neither am I, but that's alright--this is my first assignment, and I'm glad for the experience.
You don't think much of slaves, do you?
That's a sickening attitude.
I've had slaves since I was a boy, and I've never seen one suited for independence. What could have possessed them?
I'm Ensign Corian Shye, by the way. I, uh, I presume you're here to reinforce us?
I can support you, if necessary.
Certainly.
Anything you can do would be appreciated.
Why do you need reinforcements?
Reinforce you?
I do not reinforce. I crush. I destroy.
That is beneath me.
Yes, my lord. But if you intend to go in, we could use some assistance.
If it serves my purposes, perhaps I could.
Depends on how I feel.
I'm here on Imperial Intelligence business, Ensign.
I have other orders.
Of course. I understand. But frankly... we could use some assistance.
Depends on how much you want to pay.
You hiring?
Well, I, uh--we do have a fund set aside for mercenaries, if you're willing to assist.
Like I said, the slaves are animals--but we've noticed strange behavior in the pack, and my superiors want to know more.
Some of the slaves are killing each other. We don't know if they're mad, or hungry, desperate... or if there's a faction of slaves who've turned on the rest.
You've been observing them. Give me your best guess.
What do you think?
I don't really know. Who can fathom the mind of a slave?
I can see how a slave civil war would prove useful.
That has possibilities.
Exactly what the higher-ups are saying, that the killers could potentially be manipulated.
So what?
Well, it might not matter--but we want to know for certain what's going on.
We know that the killings are... ritualistic. The murderous slaves come in the night, stab their foes and paint themselves in blood.
If you could investigate... catch them in the act and take them down... maybe you could find a clue to their motives?
The slaves will give up their knowledge to me.
I'll make them talk.
I'll see what I can do--but I remember what it was like, being one of them.
I have a history with slaves.
Ah. Yes. Yes, my lord. Of course.
I'll share any information I turn up.
Intelligence can assist you.
Never thought I'd take a bounty on a killer slave.
I get the strangest jobs.
I never thought I'd see slaves run free on Dromund Kaas. But that's why we need this information--so we can crush them quickly and completely.
Very well.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
I--uh, I wish you'd reconsider. The quartermaster will make sure you're compensated for your help.
Fine.
Maybe.
Thank you. If you can determine the reason behind these killings, we'll teach the slaves a lesson.
Look for any slave who's turned on his peers. With luck, he'll lead us to answers.
No more. [Refuse quest]
Of course. Yes, of course.
I need to focus on my work now. Apologies.
